modules.description: Provides infix operators for combining and formatting text elements, including concatenation, vertical and horizontal stacking, and conditional layout. Works with a custom `t` type representing formatted text. Used to build complex layouts with intuitive operator syntax, such as aligning blocks or conditionally choosing between layouts.

This module provides functions to retrieve and represent specific ASCII characters, including punctuation, symbols, and whitespace, offering direct access to individual tokens. It works with scalar character values, focusing on isolated symbols like double quotes, brackets, and parentheses. These utilities are particularly useful in parsing scenarios or text processing tasks requiring precise character identification.
Calculates the width of a given shape using a fixed integer value. It operates on geometric data structures representing shapes. Used to determine the horizontal dimension in layout calculations.

Provides infix operators for combining and formatting text elements, including horizontal and vertical concatenation, spacing, indentation, and choice. Works with a custom `t` type representing formatted text. Used to build complex layouts with readable, concise syntax, such as formatting error messages or structured output.

This module provides functions to generate and access specific ASCII characters, including punctuation, symbols, and common text tokens like quotes, brackets, and spaces. It operates on individual character values, enabling precise manipulation of textual elements. These utilities are particularly useful in parsing tasks, constructing escape sequences, or handling symbolic notation in string processing workflows.

Provides functions for formatting and printing structured data with customizable layout and indentation. Operates on abstract syntax trees and layout specifications using a combination of combinators and layout primitives. Used to generate human-readable output for code generators, debuggers, and domain-specific languages.

Combines infix operators for building and formatting text layouts with functions for generating and manipulating individual ASCII characters. The core `t` type represents formatted text, while character utilities enable precise control over symbols and punctuation. Users can construct complex layouts with readable syntax and generate specific characters for parsing or formatting tasks. For example, it allows creating indented error messages or assembling escape sequences with exact character control.
